definition: seething discontent (idiom); popular grievances boil over
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.english: and at a time of popular insurrections in all sorts of countries.
sentences.chinese: 在那个年代，欧洲各国都民怨沸腾，起义不止。

sentences.english: The people are boiling with resentment over the officials embezzlement.
sentences.chinese: 这个官员的贪污罪行造成民怨沸腾。

definition: The people have no way to make a living (idiom, from Record of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4])/no way of getting by
to tax by force and extort levies (idiom); to screw taxes out of the people by force
the people's livelihood is reduced to destitution (idiom); a time of famine and impoverishment
lit. cries of complaint fill the roads (idiom); complaints rise all around/discontent is openly voiced
the people are impoverished, their means exhausted (idiom); to drive the nation to bankruptcy
a government official drives the people to revolt (idiom); a minister provokes a rebellion by exploiting the people
to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong/to try to turn back history/a perverse way of doing things
to engage in wars of aggression at will (idiom)/militaristic/bellicose
